json_to_edit.voice_over: The melody echoed through my dreams, a siren's call I couldn't escape.
json_to_edit.description: Lila is tormented by a mysterious melody that haunts her every night.
json_to_edit.ambience_sound_keywords: Distant wind chimes, soft rustling of curtains
json_to_edit.name: Nocturnal Serenade
json_to_edit.scene_summary: A mysterious melody haunts Lila's dreams, leading her on a surreal journey.

qa.action: Lila's bedroom bathed in moonlight, with curtains gently swaying.

hf.action: Lila's eyes flutter open, a look of recognition and fear crossing her face.

tr.action: Lila slowly sits up in bed, her gaze fixed on something unseen.

xc.action: Camera follows Lila as she walks towards her bedroom window, drawn by an invisible force.

ka.action: Through Lila's eyes, we see the full moon and a shimmering, translucent musical staff floating in the air.

fn.action: Lila's pupil dilates as the melody reaches its peak, reflecting the ghostly musical notes.

edit_command: Rearrange the order of shots to: 2, 4, 1, 6, 3, 5. Don't change anything else.

label.rationale:
we need to rearrange the order of shots as requested by the director without changing any other content. this involves updating the "list_display_order" field in the "shots" object to reflect the new order. the new order will be:

2 (hf), 4 (xc), 1 (qa), 6 (fn), 3 (tr), 5 (ka)

we'll update the "list_display_order" string accordingly while keeping all other information intact.
